item.description:
A 2-day - WET ;-) - fall hike on the Appalachian Trail starting at the AT parking area on Rte. 55 in West Pawling, NY and heading southbound to the Long Hill Rd. parking area near East Fishkill, NY (at Shenandoah Mtn. at the eastern limit of Clarence Fehnestock Memorial State Park) for a total of about 14.7 miles. This is the next segment of the AT southbound from the Oct. '08 trip for the group. We'll spend the night at a shelter on the trail (may or may not be full so plan accordingly). This hike is for moderate hikers who have done 10 mile hikes before as well as lightly equiped backpacking.

***Weather update 11/15/08: Sat. -rain and chance thunderstorms Noon to 9 PM, around 62 F. Sunset 4:35 PM. Overnight rain to 5 AM, low 49 F. Sun. -cloudy 20% 18 mph, 49 F for high, sunset at 4:34 PM***

We'll meet at Noon at the Rte. 55 parking area near West Pawling, NY (see below). The first day we'll cover 3.3 miles. We'll hike a roughly 500 ft altitude gain to the Morgan Stewart Shelter. We should be getting to the shelter by 3 pm to scrounge wood for a great fire, eat dinner, enjoy the evening, and set up for the night. The shelter should be reserved for solo hikers if there are any so please try to plan to bring a light tent and/or share tent space. If there is space in the shelter (which is likely), we can use it after nightfall. Sunset will be at 4:35 PM

On the second day, we'll continue starting 7:00 AM sharp as we have limited daylight and 11.2 miles to cover as well as less daylight. We'll end at the parking area for the AT on Long Hill Rd. near the intersection of I-84 and the Taconic State Parkway (see below). Altitude range for the day will be a general decent from 1,300 ft. on Mt. Egbert to about 500 ft., then up to about 1,100 ft on Hosner Mtn, back to about 400 ft. and up to about 1,000 ft. to end. We should end hiking by about 4:30 PM. Then we'll shuttle back to the cars at Rte. 55. If there is interest, we'll hit a place to eat in the area.

Please note that terrain, conditions, and individual party members may affect the overall timing of the hike and may necessitate backup plans if any member of the party runs into significant issues or if there are weather related issues that spring up. I have been conservitive with the estimated times and as long as all parties are reasonable fit, experienced, and equiped we should come in earlier than I estimated.

== ADVISED MUST-BRING GEAR/SUPPLIES ==
* Full pack
* Waterproofed hiking boots -Must be comfortable, & broken in
* Wool socks
* Layers of clothing -Cold mornings/nights, avoid cotton as it stays wet. Plus second day's clothing.
* Hat
* Rain parka/jacket -just in case
* Sleeping bag -3 season, rated down to 20 F
* Headlamp -LED version best
* Backpacking tent -or share/use shelter
* 2 quarts water
* 3 meals for on the trail -DAY-1: supper; DAY-2: breakfast, lunch (all trash to be packed out!). High energy meals should be planned. Only supper may be cooked but if getting up early (6:00 AM) then breakfast can be cooked too.
* Trail appropriate high energy snacks -e.g. at least G.O.R.P (Good Old Raisins and Peanuts), beef jerky, granola bars, etc.
* Sunscreen
* Emergency whistle
* Bear bag & 15' min light weight rope -for food
== OPTIONAL GEAR ==
* Camera & extra batteries
* Mess kit -If needed
* Camping utensils
* Pocket knife
* Backpacking first aid kit (for blisters & such)
* Backpacking stove and fuel -if cooking
* Waterproof matches
* Compass

Approximate location/directions to the meetup location & AT starting point, Rte. 55 in West Pawling, NY via MapQuest:
http://www.mapquest.c...


Approximate location/directions to the AT hike ending point, Long Hill Rd., E. Fishkill, NY via MapQuest:
http://www.mapquest.c....

The leader on this event is Kevin S (http://hiking.meetup.... ) so all questions should be directed to him.

Shuttle from the Manchester, CT area is possible for up to 5 additional hikers (contact Kevin S). If more than 7 people sign up we'll need an additional car at the hike endpoint to shuttle back to the start (contact Kevin S if you can help out).

=== Legal Stuff ===
By clicking on "Yes" or "Maybe" for this event you agree, warrant, and covenant as follows:

In consideration for accepting this entry, I, the registrant, intending to be legally bound, hereby, for myself, my heirs, my executors and administrators, do waive and release any and all rights for damages I may have against any parties or persons connected with the Hartford Area Hiking meetup group for and related to the above listed event. I attest and verify that I am physically fit to participate in any portion of this above listed event. I grant Hartford Area Hiking permission to use any photographs, film or videotapes of this event for any purpose.
item.how_to_find_us: We'll be with Janice's silver Jeep Liberty at the Rte. 55 parking area.
